lines.text: Enter MISTRESS FORD and MISTRESS PAGE

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: What, John! What, Robert!

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Quickly, quickly! is the buckbasket

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: I warrant. What, Robin, I say!
Enter Servants with a basket

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Come, come, come.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Here, set it down.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Give your men the charge we must be brief.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Marry, as I told you before, John and Robert, be ready here hard by in the brewhouse: and when I suddenly call you, come forth, and without any pause or staggering take this basket on your shoulders: that done, trudge with it in all haste, and carry it among the whitsters in Datchetmead, and there empty it in the muddy ditch close by the Thames side.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: You will do it

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: I ha told them over and over they lack no direction. Be gone, and come when you are called.
Exeunt Servants

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Here comes little Robin.
Enter ROBIN

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: How now, my eyasmusket! what news with you

lines.speaker: robin
lines.text: My master, Sir John, is come in at your backdoor, Mistress Ford, and requests your company.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: You little JackaLent, have you been true to us

lines.speaker: robin
lines.text: Ay, Ill be sworn. My master knows not of your being here and hath threatened to put me into everlasting liberty if I tell you of it for he swears hell turn me away.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Thourt a good boy: this secrecy of thine shall be a tailor to thee and shall make thee a new doublet and hose. Ill go hide me.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Do so. Go tell thy master I am alone. Mistress Page, remember you your cue.
Exit ROBIN

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: I warrant thee if I do not act it, hiss me.
Exit

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Go to, then: well use this unwholesome humidity, this gross watery pumpion well teach him to know turtles from jays.
Enter FALSTAFF

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Have I caught thee, my heavenly jewel Why, now let me die, for I have lived long enough: this is the period of my ambition: O this blessed hour!

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: O sweet Sir John!

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Mistress Ford, I cannot cog, I cannot prate, Mistress Ford. Now shall I sin in my wish: I would thy husband were dead: Ill speak it before the best lord I would make thee my lady.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: I your lady, Sir John! alas, I should be a pitiful lady!

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Let the court of France show me such another. I see how thine eye would emulate the diamond: thou hast the right arched beauty of the brow that becomes the shiptire, the tirevaliant, or any tire of Venetian admittance.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: A plain kerchief, Sir John: my brows become nothing else nor that well neither.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: By the Lord, thou art a traitor to say so: thou wouldst make an absolute courtier and the firm fixture of thy foot would give an excellent motion to thy gait in a semicircled farthingale. I see what thou wert, if Fortune thy foe were not, Nature thy friend. Come, thou canst not hide it.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Believe me, there is no such thing in me.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: What made me love thee let that persuade thee theres something extraordinary in thee. Come, I cannot cog and say thou art this and that, like a many of these lisping hawthornbuds, that come like women in mens apparel, and smell like Bucklersbury in simple time I cannot: but I love thee none but thee and thou deservest it.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Do not betray me, sir. I fear you love Mistress Page.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Thou mightst as well say I love to walk by the Countergate, which is as hateful to me as the reek of a limekiln.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Well, heaven knows how I love you and you shall one day find it.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Keep in that mind Ill deserve it.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Nay, I must tell you, so you do or else I could not be in that mind.

lines.speaker: robin
lines.text: [Within]  Mistress Ford, Mistress Ford! heres Mistress Page at the door, sweating and blowing and looking wildly, and would needs speak with you presently.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: She shall not see me: I will ensconce me behind the arras.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Pray you, do so: shes a very tattling woman. Whats the matter how now!
FALSTAFF hides himself
Reenter MISTRESS PAGE and ROBIN

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: O Mistress Ford, what have you done Youre shamed, youre overthrown, youre undone for ever!

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Whats the matter, good Mistress Page

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: O welladay, Mistress Ford! having an honest man to your husband, to give him such cause of suspicion!

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: What cause of suspicion

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: What cause of suspicion! Out pon you! how am I mistook in you!

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Why, alas, whats the matter

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Your husbands coming hither, woman, with all the officers in Windsor, to search for a gentleman that he says is here now in the house by your consent, to take an ill advantage of his assence: you are undone.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Tis not so, I hope.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Pray heaven it be not so, that you have such a man here! but tis most certain your husbands coming, with half Windsor at his heels, to search for such a one. I come before to tell you. If you know yourself clear, why, I am glad of it but if you have a friend here convey, convey him out. Be not amazed call all your senses to you defend your reputation, or bid farewell to your good life for ever.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: What shall I do There is a gentleman my dear friend and I fear not mine own shame so much as his peril: I had rather than a thousand pound he were out of the house.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: For shame! never stand you had rather and you had rather: your husbands here at hand, bethink you of some conveyance: in the house you cannot hide him. O, how have you deceived me! Look, here is a basket: if he be of any reasonable stature, he may creep in here and throw foul linen upon him, as if it were going to bucking: orit is whitingtime send him by your two men to Datchetmead.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Hes too big to go in there. What shall I do

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: [Coming forward]  Let me seet, let me seet, O, let me seet! Ill in, Ill in. Follow your friends counsel. Ill in.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: What, Sir John Falstaff! Are these your letters, knight

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: I love thee. Help me away. Let me creep in here. Ill never Gets into the basket they cover him with foul linen

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Help to cover your master, boy. Call your men, Mistress Ford. You dissembling knight!

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: What, John! Robert! John! Go take up these clothes here quickly. Wheres the cowlstaff look, how you drumble! Carry them to the laundress in Datchetmeat quickly, come.
Exit ROBIN
Reenter Servants
Enter FORD, PAGE, DOCTOR CAIUS, and SIR HUGH EVANS

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Pray you, come near: if I suspect without cause, why then make sport at me then let me be your jest I deserve it. How now! whither bear you this

lines.speaker: servant
lines.text: To the laundress, forsooth.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Why, what have you to do whither they bear it You were best meddle with buckwashing.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Buck! I would I could wash myself of the buck! Buck, buck, buck! Ay, buck I warrant you, buck and of the season too, it shall appear. Gentlemen, I have dreamed tonight Ill tell you my dream. Here, here, here be my keys: ascend my chambers search, seek, find out: Ill warrant well unkennel the fox. Let me stop this way first. So, now uncape.
Exeunt Servants with the basket
Locking the door

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Good Master Ford, be contented: you wrong yourself too much.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: True, Master Page. Up, gentlemen: you shall see sport anon: follow me, gentlemen.
Exit

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: This is fery fantastical humours and jealousies.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, tis no the fashion of France it is not jealous in France.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Nay, follow him, gentlemen see the issue of his search.
Exeunt PAGE, DOCTOR CAIUS, and SIR HUGH EVANS

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Is there not a double excellency in this

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: I know not which pleases me better, that my husband is deceived, or Sir John.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: What a taking was he in when your husband asked who was in the basket!

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: I am half afraid he will have need of washing so throwing him into the water will do him a benefit.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Hang him, dishonest rascal! I would all of the same strain were in the same distress.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: I think my husband hath some special suspicion of Falstaffs being here for I never saw him so gross in his jealousy till now.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: I will lay a plot to try that and we will yet have more tricks with Falstaff: his dissolute disease will scarce obey this medicine.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Shall we send that foolish carrion, Mistress Quickly, to him, and excuse his throwing into the water and give him another hope, to betray him to another punishment

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: We will do it: let him be sent for tomorrow, eight oclock, to have amends.
Reenter FORD, PAGE, DOCTOR CAIUS, and SIR HUGH EVANS

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: I cannot find him: may be the knave bragged of that he could not compass.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: [Aside to MISTRESS FORD]  Heard you that

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: You use me well, Master Ford, do you

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Ay, I do so.

lines.speaker: mistress ford
lines.text: Heaven make you better than your thoughts!

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Amen!

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: You do yourself mighty wrong, Master Ford.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Ay, ay I must bear it.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: If there be any pody in the house, and in the chambers, and in the coffers, and in the presses, heaven forgive my sins at the day of judgment!

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, nor I too: there is no bodies.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Fie, fie, Master Ford! are you not ashamed What spirit, what devil suggests this imagination I would not ha your distemper in this kind for the wealth of Windsor Castle.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Tis my fault, Master Page: I suffer for it.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: You suffer for a pad conscience: your wife is as honest a omans as I will desires among five thousand, and five hundred too.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, I see tis an honest woman.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Well, I promised you a dinner. Come, come, walk in the Park: I pray you, pardon me I will hereafter make known to you why I have done this. Come, wife come, Mistress Page. I pray you, pardon me pray heartily, pardon me.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Lets go in, gentlemen but, trust me, well mock him. I do invite you tomorrow morning to my house to breakfast: after, well abirding together I have a fine hawk for the bush. Shall it be so

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Any thing.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: If there is one, I shall make two in the company.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: If dere be one or two, I shall makea the turd.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Pray you, go, Master Page.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: I pray you now, remembrance tomorrow on the lousy knave, mine host.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Dat is good by gar, with all my heart!

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: A lousy knave, to have his gibes and his mockeries!
Exeunt
